parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns if the given soldier is able to stand up.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Boolean]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''canStand''' unitName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] -  
[[true]] if he's still able to stand up, [[false]] if not. Automatically return [[false]] if unit is vehicle.
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> [[SQS]]: <code>?!([[canStand]] [[player]]) : [[player]] [[groupChat]] "My legs! They hit my legs!"</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] (![[canStand]] [[player]]) then 
{
     [[player]] [[groupChat]] "My legs! They hit my legs!";
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[canMove]], [[canFire]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The command may return true for dead units.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>



[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.99|CANSTAND]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.96|CANSTAND]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.46|CANSTAND]]
